title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 7305.3 - Identification
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 7305.3 - Identification

State Regulations
(a) Consistent with
the requirements of this section, identification procedures, including
photographs, shall be established for youth confined in a facility. (b) When, in the opinion of the director, or
designee, the growth or removal of a youth's hair, including facial hair, creates an identification problem, a new photograph may be taken of the
youth. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
7305.3

Adopted

New

York State Register September 26, 2018/Volume XL, Issue 39, eff. 9/26/2018

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
